Package com.rapidminer.belt.buffer

Class TimeBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rapidminer.belt.buffer.TimeBuffer
  • public final class TimeBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
    A buffer for time instances with nanosecond precision. Wraps a primitive double array.
    Author:
    Gisa Meier
    See Also:
    Buffers

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public java.time.LocalTime get​(int index)
        Retrieves the value at the given index.

        Set operations are not atomic. Multiple threads working on the same index require additional synchronization, however, concurrent operations on disjoint intervals do not.

        Parameters:
        index - the index to look up
        Returns:
        the value at the index

      • set

        public void set​(int index,
                long nanoOfDay)
        Sets the data at the given index to the given value. To set missing values please use set(index, null).

        This method is not atomic. Multiple threads working on the same index require additional synchronization, however, concurrent operations on disjoint intervals do not.

        Parameters:
        index - the index where the value should be set
        nanoOfDay - the nanoseconds of the day from from 00:00 to 23:59:59.999999999
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if epochSeconds is smaller than MIN_NANO or bigger than MAX_NANO

      • set

        public void set​(int index,
                java.time.LocalTime time)
        Sets the data at the given index to the given time.

        This method is not atomic. Multiple threads working on the same index require additional synchronization, however, concurrent operations on disjoint intervals do not.

        Parameters:
        index - the index where the value should be set
        time - the time it should be set to, can be null

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns:
        the size of the buffer

      • toColumn

        public com.rapidminer.belt.column.TimeColumn toColumn()
        Creates a new time column from the buffer.
        Returns:
        a new TimeColumn

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
